title: Patient Name
instruction: Only return the patients name and not the doctors name or anyone else's name

title: Chief Complaint
instruction: Please provide only the patient's chief complaint without any additional details or context. Avoid direct speech.

title: HPI Spencer
instruction:
Write a detailed History of Present Illness (HPI) summary in scribe style. Include the following elements clearly: 
1. Onset (when it started, mechanism of injury if mentioned, and first symptoms).
2. Duration (how long symptoms have persisted, changes over time, and whether continuous or intermittent).
3. Location (specific body part(s), side, and context such as activity or hand dominance if mentioned).
4. Severity (describe pain, stiffness, limitation, or functional impact in the same words used by the clinician).

Rules:
- Use complete sentences and natural, clinical-note style language instead of just listing fields.
- Incorporate important contextual details provided by the clinician or patient (e.g., mechanism of injury, urgent care visits, sutures, re-injury).
- Do not invent information. Only use what is explicitly or implicitly present in the transcript.
- The output should read like a full HPI paragraph similar to a dictated clinical note, not just bullet points.

title: Musculoskeletal
instruction: What is the physical examination finding of this patient related to Musculoskeletal. If not information is found, please return empty.Must be extract what doctor has dictated, Do not change/modify any thing. must be verbatim.

title: Assessment
instruction: Generate a list of the patient's current medical conditions using simple, concise language as typically seen in a medical scribe note.Rules- Only include active symptoms or conditions relevant to the current visit.- Use general terms (e.g., "right forearm hypersensitivity" instead of anatomical/nerve distribution terms).- Do not include normal findings such as “skin is intact” or “no tenderness to palpation.”- Do not include any exam findings or historical medical information.- Return only the current issue(s) as a list.- If skin is intact say 'Right upper extremity Skin is intact.'. - If no tendon palpation. say ' No tenderness to palpation. '

title: Plan
instruction: Write a scribe-style summary of the healthcare provider’s plan of action based on the clinical conversation. Use natural, conversational language that flows like a dictated clinical note. Include treatment recommendations, therapies (including self-therapy or formal therapy), any discussion or education provided to the patient, lifestyle modifications, and follow-up instructions. Be sure to include the follow-up time in a conversational tone, e.g., “return to clinic in 6 to 8 weeks.” Mention any relevant findings or explanations discussed with the patient, and reflect how the provider explains the reasoning behind the treatment.RULESReturn in multiples sentence in listsUser numbers instead of word where necessary , "6 to 8 weeks"
